Sentencas: In a systematic study, two compositional series of ceria-based oxides, both co-doped with Sm and Gd, were synthesised using a low temperature method and evaluated as oxygen ion-conducting electrolytes for Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: Series one, Ce1-2xSmxGdxO2-x had equal concentrations of Sm and Gd but varying total dopant concentration.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: Series two, Ce-0.825,SmxGd0.175-xO1.9125, had a fixed total dopant concentration but the Sm:Gd concentration ratio was varied.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: The materials were characterised using scanning and transmission electron microscopy, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry and X-ray diffraction.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: Impedance spectra were recorded on dense pellets of these materials.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: From these, total, bulk and grain boundary conductivities and capacitances along with activation energies, pre-exponential constants and enthalpies of ion migration and defect association were obtained.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: These gave a detailed insight into the fundamental conduction processes in the materials.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: Ce0.825Sm0.0875Gd0.0875O1.9125 had the highest total ionic conductivity at temperatures of 550 degrees C and above and also demonstrated an enhanced conductivity with respect to its singly-doped parent compounds, Ce0.825Sm0.175O1.9125 and Ce0.825Gd0.175O1.9125, at 400 degrees C and above.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium

Sentencas: This compares favourably with previously-reported values and has promising implications for the development of IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Oxygen ion conductivity in ceria-based electrolytes co-doped with samarium and gadolinium
